meanings.definition: To dislike or have an unfavorable opinion of.
meanings.sent1: She misliked the taste of the medicine.
meanings.sent2: He always misliked the rainy weather.
meanings.sent3: The cat misliked the new brand of food and refused to eat it.
meanings.sent4: The student misliked the strict rules imposed by the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The baby misliked the bitter flavor of the vegetable puree.

meanings.sent1: The misliked movie received poor reviews from critics.
meanings.sent2: The old, misliked chair was finally replaced with a new one.
meanings.sent3: The misliked painting was hidden away in the attic.
meanings.sent4: The misliked decision caused tension among the group.
meanings.sent5: The misliked dish was left untouched on the dinner table.
